partintro.para: Simpleweb jQuery Plugin is composed of sample codes created by using a common Controller class and tag libraries that use JSON type data and reference libraries necessary to use them to enable developer to develop Spring MVC-based web applications more easily and simply. Here are also included the samples on ways to connect with jQuery. The jQuery components used in Plugin sample codes include jqgrid, quickpager, autocomplete, jstree, ui-tab, dropdown, uploadify, etc.
Install simpleweb-jquery plugin by entering the following command in the Command window.
The installation result can be checked by using the installed (mvn anyframe:installed) or the jetty:run (mvn clean jetty:run) commands.

book.part:
Development of Simpleweb using jQuery
In this chapter the way to connect Simpleweb and jQuery will be explained centering on Sample Application generated when Simpleweb jQuery Plugin (simpleweb-jquery) is installed. The data that is shown on the screen when jQuery is used is returned in the JSON object type. Basically the components of jQuery provided by Sample Application created when simpleweb-jquery plugin is installed include jqgrid, jstree, autocomplete, dropdown, jquery-ui, quickpager, and uploadify. All the files related to jQuery (js and css) exist under the [project]/src/main/webapp/simpleweb-jquery/jquery folder.
These js or css files related to jQuery are defined at the top of standard.jsp used by simpleweb-jquery. The following is part of the standard.jsp file added by installing simpleweb plugin.
<!-- for jquery --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jquery-1.6.2.min.js'/>"></script> <link rel="stylesheet" href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/css/jquery.css'/>" type="text/css" />
<!-- jquery ui, jqGrid --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jqgrid/i18n/grid.locale-en.js'/>"></script> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jquery-ui/jquery-ui-1.8.16.custom.min.js'/>"></script> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jqgrid/jquery.jqGrid.min.js'/>"></script> <link href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jqgrid/ui.jqgrid.css'/>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<!-- jquery form --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/form/jquery.form.js'/>"></script>
<!-- jquery:jstree-1.0.RC3 --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jstree/jquery.jstree.js'/>"></script>
<!-- jquery tab --> <link href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/jquery-ui/smoothness/jquery-ui-1.8.16.custom.css'/>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<!-- jquery uploadify --> <link type="text/css" href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/uploadify/uploadify.css'/>" rel="stylesheet"> <script src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/uploadify/swfobject.js'/>" type="text/javascript"></script> <script src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/uploadify/jquery.uploadify.v2.1.4.min.js'/>" type="text/javascript"></script>
<!-- jquery image dropdown --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/dropdown/msdropdown/js/jquery.dd.js'/>"></script> <link href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/dropdown/msdropdown/dd.css'/>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
<!-- quick pager --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/quickpager/quickpager.mod.jquery.js'/>"></script> <link rel="stylesheet" href="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/quickpager/pagination.css'/>" type="text/css" />
<!-- validator --> <script type="text/javascript" src="<c:url value='/simpleweb-jquery/jquery/validate/jquery.validate.js'/>"></script>
Only the files on necessary components among the js and css files imported above will be defined. jQuery also provides various plugin-type components, which can be used in connection when necessary. When basically JSON-type objects are used, the basic usage of Anyframe Tag Library is the same as when VO or Map are used. Let us look at how to connect basic components of jQuery mentioned above.
